title: Rear Brake Master Cylinder - Installation

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Caution - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.

Position the brake pedal to the pushrod, engage the clevis and retain it with the clip. Ensure the clip is fitted as shown below:
Refit the brake fluid reservoir and its hose to the master cylinder as noted during removal. Secure with the clip.

Install and torque the control plate bottom fixing to
Incorporating new washers to either side of the union, fit the brake line. Tighten the union bolt to
Put the right hand heel guard in position. Install and torque the heel guard fixings to
Bleed the rear brakes - D71; D74; DR4; DS4
Check the operation of the brake and carry out a thorough leak check before riding the motorcycle.

body.body: It is dangerous to operate the motorcycle with defective brakes; you must have your authorised Triumph dealer take remedial action before you attempt to ride the motorcycle again. Failure to take remedial action may reduce braking efficiency leading to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Check the operation of the rear brake. Rectify as necessary.
